content.question: Which of the following has been viewed by some historians as an indication of strong anti-Catholic sentiment in the presidential election of 1928?

choices.label: The increased political activity of the Ku Klux Klan
The failure of the farm bloc to go to the polls
Alfred E. Smith’s choice of Arkansas senator Joseph T. Robinson as his running mate
Alfred E. Smith’s failure to carry a solidly Democratic South
Herbert Hoover’s use of “rugged individualism” as his campaign slogan

content.answer: Alfred E. Smith’s failure to carry a solidly Democratic South

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
